DamageResistances: Bludgeoning, Slashing and Piercing from non-magical weapons, Fire

Traits.Name: Ambush Predator
Traits.Content: The Capelobo has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have not taken a turn in the current combat.

Traits.Name: Jungle Navigator
Traits.Content: The Capelobo can traverse difficult terrain at normal speed in jungle environments and has advantage on Dexterity checks related to climbing and jumping.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Springer, Capelobo makes three attacks: one with Bite, one with Claw, and one with Charge. When its special ability is available, it can use the ability in place of Bite or Claw.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be grappled. While grappled in this way, the target is also restrained until the grapple ends.

Actions.Name: Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is grappled, the Capelobo can drain some vitality, regaining hit points equal to the damage dealt.

Actions.Name: Charge
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet and knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Blood Frenzy (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: The Capelobo enters a frenzied state, creating an effect in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, if any creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this ability, the Capelobo regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
